{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=R6700 |revision=v1 |series=AC1750 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H270 |manuf_rev=T10 |fcc_date=06/20/2014 |fcc_id=PY313200233 |ic_id=4054A-13200233 |pcb_id=U12H270T10 |type=wireless router |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4709A0;BCM4709A0KFEBG, TT1308 P10, E9MCJ-01 Z1C; |cpu1_cspeed=1.0 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 MiB |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D |ram1=256 MiB |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B2G1646E-BCK0 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, 3.3V TTL |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1312 P20, 273016 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2623L;SKY, 2623L, 322BD;3;,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 243BE, 1243 MY;3; |stock_boot=CFE;1.0.22; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.36.4; |tp_firmware=DD-WRT (kongac ARM), FreshTomato |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=E4:F4:C6 |oui_eth=E4:F4:C6 }}
:• '''1300''' Mbps - 3SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''450''' Mbps - 3SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''1750 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|Nighthawk AC1750 Smart WiFi Router}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.netgear.com/home/products/networking/wifi-routers/R6700.aspx}} {{SupportPage|vendor=Netgear|model=R6700}} *[[Netgear R7000]] • Board ID: U12H270T00_NETGEAR *[[Netgear R6700]] • Board ID: U12H270T10_NETGEAR Most of the information on this page was copied from the [[Netgear R7000]] :since the FCC ID on the R6700's label is the same. This router appears to be stripped down R7000 exclusively for Costco like :the [[Netgear AC1450]] was. Changes from the R7000 to this R6700 appear to be the removal of the USB :2.0 port and a claim of only N450 speeds at 2.4GHz instead of N600. [https://fccid.io/document.php?id=2301434 ''Description of Permissive Change''] document (dated 6/20/2014) at the FCC describing :what was changed from the R7000 to the R6700. "This report is prepared for FCC class II permissive change. :The difference compared with the original design is as the following information: *There are board changes (depopulation), Firmware changes, Housing back panel :changes and documentation changes: :a. Remove USB 2.0 from the back. Depopulation from the current board :b. Remove support for 2.4G 256QAM :c. Change model name from R7000 to R6700 :d. LED icon for USB 2.0 changed to Guest Wifi" ===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=268918 ''Netgear R6700'' on '''DD-WRT''' forums] :OEM: [[Foxconn]] ([[Ambit]]) [https://github.com/mirror/dd-wrt/blob/master/src/router/netgear/ambitCfg-r6700.h U12H270T10] __NOTOC__
